{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Administrative Executive (Office of the CEO)",
  "description": "At Coollink, our passion drives us to create innovative technology solutions that empower enterprises and SMEs across Nigeria and Africa.&nbsp;For over two decades, we&rsquo;ve been pioneering satellite broadband and IT services, bringing reliable, affordable connectivity to even the most remote regions. Now, we&rsquo;re expanding our expertise to deliver more than just connectivity&mdash;we provide end-to-end IT solutions that fuel businesses of all sizes.

From startups and SMEs to large enterprises, we offer the tools and support necessary to thrive in an increasingly digital world. Our IT services cover everything from cloud solutions and network security to managed services, ensuring businesses stay connected, secure, and efficient.&nbsp;With our Partners, we&rsquo;re pushing the boundaries of what&#39;s possible, ensuring businesses and communities across Africa have access to world-class connectivity and IT solutions. Whether it&#39;s urban hubs or remote locations, geography is no barrier&mdash;we connect people to the technology that transforms lives and industries.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Executive (Office of the CEO)
Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island,&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: CEO
Industry: Engineering Consultancy, Information Technology &amp; Broadcasting

Overview


	The Administrative Executive (Office of the CEO) provides high-level administrative, organizational, and operational support to ensure efficient management of the CEO&rsquo;s professional and personal affairs across the Group&rsquo;s business interests in engineering consultancy, IT, and broadcasting. Responsibilities include calendar management, departmental coordination, tracking the execution of CEO directives, and handling both business and personal administrative tasks.
	The role demands exceptional confidentiality, initiative, responsiveness, and attention to detail.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage and synchronize the CEO&rsquo;s business and personal calendar.
	Handle confidential communication, reports, and documentation.
	Draft and prepare meeting agendas, minutes, and follow-up action summaries.
	Follow up on all instructions issued by the CEO to ensure timely execution and feedback.
	Coordinate communication with internal departments and external stakeholders.
	Arrange and confirm local and international travel logistics.
	Maintain records, expense tracking, and organized filing systems.
	Execute personal and executive errands, event schedules, and logistics with complete discretion.
	Send a daily Teams summary each evening, outlining the CEO&rsquo;s next-day priorities, agenda, and travel alerts.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business Administration or a related discipline.
	4 - 6 years of experience supporting C-level or senior leadership in a structured environment.
	Strong command of Microsoft 365 (Outlook, Teams, Planner, SharePoint, Excel, PowerPoint).
	Excellent time management, communication, and multitasking skills.
	Calm, presentable, emotionally intelligent, and able to handle high-pressure executive tasks with grace.
	Demonstrated integrity and discretion in managing sensitive information.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should&nbsp;send their updated CV and a detailed and professional Cover Letter clearly demonstrating relevant experience supporting executives, the ability to manage complex schedules and confidential tasks, and Personal strengths that align with the demands of the CEO&rsquo;s office to:&nbsp;24716d91.coollink.ng@emea.teams.ms&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-17",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Coollink Limited"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "188974"
  },

Administrative Executive (Office of the CEO) Job at Coollink Limited




        
    

        
        At Coollink, our passion drives us to create innovative technology solutions that empower enterprises and SMEs across Nigeria and Africa. For over two decades, we’ve been pioneering satellite broadband and IT services, bringing reliable, affordable connectivity to even the most remote regions. Now, we’re expanding our expertise to deliver more than just connectivity—we provide end-to-end IT solutions that fuel businesses of all sizes.
     

            
    



From startups and SMEs to large enterprises, we offer the tools and support necessary to thrive in an increasingly digital world. Our IT services cover everything from cloud solutions and network security to managed services, ensuring businesses stay connected, secure, and efficient. With our Partners, we’re pushing the boundaries of what's possible, ensuring businesses and communities across Africa have access to world-class connectivity and IT solutions. Whether it's urban hubs or remote locations, geography is no barrier—we connect people to the technology that transforms lives and industries.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Executive (Office of the CEO)
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: CEO
Industry: Engineering Consultancy, Information Technology & Broadcasting

Overview


	The Administrative Executive (Office of the CEO) provides high-level administrative, organizational, and operational support to ensure efficient management of the CEO’s professional and personal affairs across the Group’s business interests in engineering consultancy, IT, and broadcasting. Responsibilities include calendar management, departmental coordination, tracking the execution of CEO directives, and handling both business and personal administrative tasks.
	The role demands exceptional confidentiality, initiative, responsiveness, and attention to detail.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage and synchronize the CEO’s business and personal calendar.
	Handle confidential communication, reports, and documentation.
	Draft and prepare meeting agendas, minutes, and follow-up action summaries.
	Follow up on all instructions issued by the CEO to ensure timely execution and feedback.
	Coordinate communication with internal departments and external stakeholders.
	Arrange and confirm local and international travel logistics.
	Maintain records, expense tracking, and organized filing systems.
	Execute personal and executive errands, event schedules, and logistics with complete discretion.
	Send a daily Teams summary each evening, outlining the CEO’s next-day priorities, agenda, and travel alerts.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration or a related discipline.
	4 - 6 years of experience supporting C-level or senior leadership in a structured environment.
	Strong command of Microsoft 365 (Outlook, Teams, Planner, SharePoint, Excel, PowerPoint).
	Excellent time management, communication, and multitasking skills.
	Calm, presentable, emotionally intelligent, and able to handle high-pressure executive tasks with grace.
	Demonstrated integrity and discretion in managing sensitive information.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV and a detailed and professional Cover Letter clearly demonstrating relevant experience supporting executives, the ability to manage complex schedules and confidential tasks, and Personal strengths that align with the demands of the CEO’s office to: 24716d91.coollink.ng@emea.teams.ms using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Frontend Developer",
  "description": "Brickfort is a holding company and family office focused on long-term investments across sectors such as private equity, real estate, technology, and energy. We manage a diverse portfolio with the aim of maximising returns and supporting sustainable growth. Additionally, Brickfort combines a disciplined investment approach with a commitment to responsible and ethical business&nbsp;practices, building a legacy of lasting impact.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Frontend Developer

Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria (Remote)
Job type: Contract
Duration: 4&ndash;5 Month Project

Job Detail


	We&rsquo;re looking for a skilled Frontend Developer to join our team on a 4 to 5-month project-based role. If you have experience building clean, responsive user interfaces and working with modern JavaScript frameworks, we&rsquo;d love to hear from you.


Requirements
Applicants should have strong proficiency in:


	ReactJS / NextJS / Typescript
	State management* (e.g. Redux, Zustand, or similar)
	Memory efficiency and performance optimization
	API integrations and data handling
	Authentication and role-based access control
	Understanding of microfrontend architecture.


Renumeration
N700,000 - N1,000,000 (based on experience)

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Links to past projects or portfolio&nbsp;to:&nbsp;s.aghughu@brickfort.co.uk&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Frontend Developer Job at Brickfort




        
    

        
        Brickfort is a holding company and family office focused on long-term investments across sectors such as private equity, real estate, technology, and energy. We manage a diverse portfolio with the aim of maximising returns and supporting sustainable growth. Additionally, Brickfort combines a disciplined investment approach with a commitment to responsible and ethical business practices, building a legacy of lasting impact.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Frontend Developer

Job Location: Nigeria (Remote)
Job type: Contract
Duration: 4–5 Month Project

Job Detail
     

            
    




	We’re looking for a skilled Frontend Developer to join our team on a 4 to 5-month project-based role. If you have experience building clean, responsive user interfaces and working with modern JavaScript frameworks, we’d love to hear from you.


Requirements
Applicants should have strong proficiency in:


	ReactJS / NextJS / Typescript
	State management* (e.g. Redux, Zustand, or similar)
	Memory efficiency and performance optimization
	API integrations and data handling
	Authentication and role-based access control
	Understanding of microfrontend architecture.


Renumeration
N700,000 - N1,000,000 (based on experience)

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Links to past projects or portfolio to: s.aghughu@brickfort.co.uk using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Administrative Executive (Office of the CEO)",
  "description": "At Coollink, our passion drives us to create innovative technology solutions that empower enterprises and SMEs across Nigeria and Africa.&nbsp;For over two decades, we&rsquo;ve been pioneering satellite broadband and IT services, bringing reliable, affordable connectivity to even the most remote regions. Now, we&rsquo;re expanding our expertise to deliver more than just connectivity&mdash;we provide end-to-end IT solutions that fuel businesses of all sizes.

From startups and SMEs to large enterprises, we offer the tools and support necessary to thrive in an increasingly digital world. Our IT services cover everything from cloud solutions and network security to managed services, ensuring businesses stay connected, secure, and efficient.&nbsp;With our Partners, we&rsquo;re pushing the boundaries of what&#39;s possible, ensuring businesses and communities across Africa have access to world-class connectivity and IT solutions. Whether it&#39;s urban hubs or remote locations, geography is no barrier&mdash;we connect people to the technology that transforms lives and industries.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Executive (Office of the CEO)
Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island,&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: CEO
Industry: Engineering Consultancy, Information Technology &amp; Broadcasting

Overview


	The Administrative Executive (Office of the CEO) provides high-level administrative, organizational, and operational support to ensure efficient management of the CEO&rsquo;s professional and personal affairs across the Group&rsquo;s business interests in engineering consultancy, IT, and broadcasting. Responsibilities include calendar management, departmental coordination, tracking the execution of CEO directives, and handling both business and personal administrative tasks.
	The role demands exceptional confidentiality, initiative, responsiveness, and attention to detail.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage and synchronize the CEO&rsquo;s business and personal calendar.
	Handle confidential communication, reports, and documentation.
	Draft and prepare meeting agendas, minutes, and follow-up action summaries.
	Follow up on all instructions issued by the CEO to ensure timely execution and feedback.
	Coordinate communication with internal departments and external stakeholders.
	Arrange and confirm local and international travel logistics.
	Maintain records, expense tracking, and organized filing systems.
	Execute personal and executive errands, event schedules, and logistics with complete discretion.
	Send a daily Teams summary each evening, outlining the CEO&rsquo;s next-day priorities, agenda, and travel alerts.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business Administration or a related discipline.
	4 - 6 years of experience supporting C-level or senior leadership in a structured environment.
	Strong command of Microsoft 365 (Outlook, Teams, Planner, SharePoint, Excel, PowerPoint).
	Excellent time management, communication, and multitasking skills.
	Calm, presentable, emotionally intelligent, and able to handle high-pressure executive tasks with grace.
	Demonstrated integrity and discretion in managing sensitive information.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should&nbsp;send their updated CV and a detailed and professional Cover Letter clearly demonstrating relevant experience supporting executives, the ability to manage complex schedules and confidential tasks, and Personal strengths that align with the demands of the CEO&rsquo;s office to:&nbsp;24716d91.coollink.ng@emea.teams.ms&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Administrative Executive (Office of the CEO) Job at Coollink Limited




        
    

        
        At Coollink, our passion drives us to create innovative technology solutions that empower enterprises and SMEs across Nigeria and Africa. For over two decades, we’ve been pioneering satellite broadband and IT services, bringing reliable, affordable connectivity to even the most remote regions. Now, we’re expanding our expertise to deliver more than just connectivity—we provide end-to-end IT solutions that fuel businesses of all sizes.
     

            
    



From startups and SMEs to large enterprises, we offer the tools and support necessary to thrive in an increasingly digital world. Our IT services cover everything from cloud solutions and network security to managed services, ensuring businesses stay connected, secure, and efficient. With our Partners, we’re pushing the boundaries of what's possible, ensuring businesses and communities across Africa have access to world-class connectivity and IT solutions. Whether it's urban hubs or remote locations, geography is no barrier—we connect people to the technology that transforms lives and industries.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Executive (Office of the CEO)
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: CEO
Industry: Engineering Consultancy, Information Technology & Broadcasting

Overview


	The Administrative Executive (Office of the CEO) provides high-level administrative, organizational, and operational support to ensure efficient management of the CEO’s professional and personal affairs across the Group’s business interests in engineering consultancy, IT, and broadcasting. Responsibilities include calendar management, departmental coordination, tracking the execution of CEO directives, and handling both business and personal administrative tasks.
	The role demands exceptional confidentiality, initiative, responsiveness, and attention to detail.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage and synchronize the CEO’s business and personal calendar.
	Handle confidential communication, reports, and documentation.
	Draft and prepare meeting agendas, minutes, and follow-up action summaries.
	Follow up on all instructions issued by the CEO to ensure timely execution and feedback.
	Coordinate communication with internal departments and external stakeholders.
	Arrange and confirm local and international travel logistics.
	Maintain records, expense tracking, and organized filing systems.
	Execute personal and executive errands, event schedules, and logistics with complete discretion.
	Send a daily Teams summary each evening, outlining the CEO’s next-day priorities, agenda, and travel alerts.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration or a related discipline.
	4 - 6 years of experience supporting C-level or senior leadership in a structured environment.
	Strong command of Microsoft 365 (Outlook, Teams, Planner, SharePoint, Excel, PowerPoint).
	Excellent time management, communication, and multitasking skills.
	Calm, presentable, emotionally intelligent, and able to handle high-pressure executive tasks with grace.
	Demonstrated integrity and discretion in managing sensitive information.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV and a detailed and professional Cover Letter clearly demonstrating relevant experience supporting executives, the ability to manage complex schedules and confidential tasks, and Personal strengths that align with the demands of the CEO’s office to: 24716d91.coollink.ng@emea.teams.ms using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Sales and Marketing Executive",
  "description": "MacTay Consulting is one of the first and leading management consulting firms in Nigeria, providing HR services to our clients in Africa since 1982. We focus on adding value to organisations through customized solutions that meet our clients&rsquo; needs. We have a proven track record of providing excellent services that impact our clients&rsquo; businesses.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales and Marketing Executive
Job Location:&nbsp;Surulere,&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Sector: Health and wellness

Job Summary


	This position involves sales and marketing activities, promotions, events, and training programs to optimize the performance of the company&rsquo;s distributor network.
	Reporting directly to the Sales and marketing manager, the Sales &amp; Marketing Executive works to strengthen the connection between the company and its distribution network.


Responsibilities


	Develop and implement sales and marketing strategies to achieve company targets and increase market share.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with distributors, clients, and key stakeholders to drive product awareness and loyalty.
	Conduct product presentations, training sessions, and promotional activities for distributors and retail partners.
	Identify and pursue new business opportunities, market segments, and distribution channels.
	Coordinate marketing campaigns, events, and wellness programs to promote brand visibility and customer engagement.
	Monitor and analyze sales performance, market trends, and competitor activities to provide actionable insights.
	Collaborate with the marketing team to create marketing materials, digital content, and promotional tools.
	Ensure compliance with company policies, marketing ethics, and health industry regulations.
	Support the Sales &amp; Marketing Manager in planning and executing strategic initiatives.


Requirements


	A Degree in Marketing, Business Administration or any related field.
	2 - 4 years of experience in sales and marketing.
	Previous record of working in a health or pharmaceutical company.
	A history of meeting or exceeding sales targets and demonstrated success in building and managing effective marketing strategies.


Salary
N250,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@mactay.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-11-21",

  },

Sales and Marketing Executive Job at MacTay Consulting




        
    

        
        MacTay Consulting is one of the first and leading management consulting firms in Nigeria, providing HR services to our clients in Africa since 1982. We focus on adding value to organisations through customized solutions that meet our clients’ needs. We have a proven track record of providing excellent services that impact our clients’ businesses.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales and Marketing Executive
Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Sector: Health and wellness

Job Summary
     

            
    




	This position involves sales and marketing activities, promotions, events, and training programs to optimize the performance of the company’s distributor network.
	Reporting directly to the Sales and marketing manager, the Sales & Marketing Executive works to strengthen the connection between the company and its distribution network.


Responsibilities


	Develop and implement sales and marketing strategies to achieve company targets and increase market share.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with distributors, clients, and key stakeholders to drive product awareness and loyalty.
	Conduct product presentations, training sessions, and promotional activities for distributors and retail partners.
	Identify and pursue new business opportunities, market segments, and distribution channels.
	Coordinate marketing campaigns, events, and wellness programs to promote brand visibility and customer engagement.
	Monitor and analyze sales performance, market trends, and competitor activities to provide actionable insights.
	Collaborate with the marketing team to create marketing materials, digital content, and promotional tools.
	Ensure compliance with company policies, marketing ethics, and health industry regulations.
	Support the Sales & Marketing Manager in planning and executing strategic initiatives.


Requirements


	A Degree in Marketing, Business Administration or any related field.
	2 - 4 years of experience in sales and marketing.
	Previous record of working in a health or pharmaceutical company.
	A history of meeting or exceeding sales targets and demonstrated success in building and managing effective marketing strategies.


Salary
N250,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@mactay.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

	Prepare, update, and manage official records and correspondence

Salary
N120,000 - N150,000 monthly.

Administrative Officer Job at TAIDOB College




        
    

        
        TAIDOB College is a government-approved private secondary school strategically located within Goshen Estate, Asero, Abeokuta, Ogun State. Dr. Abayomi Oluwatosin Jiboku, a seasoned educationist cum administrator established the college in October 1994 as a model with the motive of providing educational services to all races irrespective of gender, religion, tribe or social status. This unique citadel of learning is situated in a quiet, serene and conducive environment, equipped with modern educational infrastructural facilities and of dedicated and experienced tutors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Officer
     

            
    



Job Location: Abeokuta, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Ensure smooth day-to-day running of the office operations
	Prepare, update, and manage official records and correspondence
	Ensure submission of reports and documentation
	Schedule and coordinate meetings, appointments, and evets.
	Assist with staff attendance records
	Maintain updated staff & student files.


Requirements


	Must possess at least a B.Sc., B.Ed., or HND, in Business Administration, Mass Communication, Marketing or other related fields from reputable institutions.
	Must possess at least 2 years of cognate experience working as an administrator/ marketer.
	Meticulous attention to detail with superb organizational skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Salary
